videos.title: Trump's response to Russian bounties on US troops leaves lawmakers wanting answers

transcript.text:
is that a Russian
military spy agency

known as the GRU
offered bounties,

militants in Afghanistan
to kill coalition forces.

President Trump has consistently
now tweeted out

that he was not
briefed on this report.

He tweeted that he was told
by the US intelligence

that they did not find
the information credible
and thus did not brief him.

One wonders, well, if the
intelligence was not credible,

why was
the National Security Council

running a meeting back
in late March

to discuss the report and begin
to think about response options.

Right now, the Hill has reacted
quite strongly with the Speaker,

-We have called for a report
to the congress on this.
This is as bad as it gets.

-Senator Lindsey Graham has said
he wants to know

whether or not
the reports are true.

It could have been that
the information

was in the president's written
presidential daily brief,

but the president famously
does not read his written PDB.

He gets his briefings orally
about three times a week.

So if something is in the PDB,
it's not a given

that he has seen it,
read it, or even heard about it.

His summit with Putin
in Helsinki in July of 2018

shocked, stunned many after
he seemed to side with Putin

over his own
US intelligence agencies

after they concluded
with high confidence

This is unprecedented for Russia
to have targeted US troops

on the ground
like this in this way,

certainly for the GRU
to do that in Afghanistan.

I don't think this is something
that's going to go away

Bolton tells how the President of the Republic Sauli Niinistö advised Trump on the treatment of Russian President Vladimir Putin. When the presidents met in Mäntyniemi, Niinistö had presented Trump with three points about working with Russia.

 First, he dealt with Putin and his encounter.  According to Niinistö, Putin is a fighter whose every attack Trump would have to respond by striking back.

 As another matter, Niinistö emphasized that by showing respect to Putin, it is possible to create a more confident relationship, in which case he may be more tactful.

 Niinistö’s third point came as if from the boxing coach’s mouth, as Bolton described, when he told Trump that Putin should not be allowed to strike a single hole, nor give up an inch.

 Niinistö decided to rip Trump, saying that “the Cossack will take what is loosely attached”.

 At that time, the presidents also discussed Finland's national defense status.  Niinistö had reminded Trump of the strength of the Finnish Defense Forces' war of 280,000 people during the war, and that attacking Finland would be costly for the attacker. Trump had asked if Finland wanted to join NATO.  Niinistö gave a complicated answer, and did not say yes or no, but left the door open for possible accession.  Niinistö said Putin is not stupid and would not attack NATO country.

Here is an article from 2014 explaining the background of that Cossack saying.
--
"One instructive Russian proverb is:" Kazak berjot shto ploho leshit "or" Cossack takes what is loose."
Undoubtedly, this doctrine of household maintenance based on experience is worth listening to.  We have to take care of things, we have to hold on.  If you don’t, it can start to happen. ”

 This is what President Sauli Niinistö said at the opening of the national defense course on Monday. The comment caused confusion in Finland, and Niinistö refused to explain in more detail whether the comment was related to the situation in Ukraine, the annexation of Crimea to Russia or what.

 We asked Alexei Pushkov, Chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the Russian Duma, who is visiting Finland, if the proverb is familiar.

 - Kazak berjot shto ploho leshit?  The Cossacks lived mostly in Ukraine. That means the Cossack takes what is out of control.  If you leave something somewhere and you don’t take care of it, then the passing Cossack will come and take it for himself.  It can be a horse, a car or even a trunk. Things have to be taken care of, otherwise the Cossack will come and take it, Pushkov explains.

 - The Cossacks originally consisted of people who fled Russia in the 15th and 15th centuries and ended up in Ukraine.  They were land slaves who fled their masters in Russia.  They were basically free people, but some of them formed gangs of bandits along the way.  Why else do you ask this?

 - I ask because yesterday our President Sauli Niinistö used this phrase and added that it is worth listening to this household doctrine, you have to take care of your things and goods and if you do not, all sorts of things can happen.

@t00by00zer # Russia’s Effort to Sow Discord #

On February 16, 2018 Special Counsel Robert S. Mueller III indicted 13 Russian individuals and three Russian organizations for engaging in operations to interfere with U.S. political and electoral processes, including the 2016 presidential election. This was a significant step forward in exposing a surreptitious social media campaign and holding accountable those responsible for this attack. The indictment spells out in exhaustive detail the breadth and systematic nature of this conspiracy, dating back to 2014, as well as the multiple ways in which Russian actors misused online platforms to carry out their clandestine operations.

Throughout the indictment, Mueller lays out important facts about the activities of the Internet Research Agency (IRA)—the notorious Russian “troll” farm—and its operatives:

“Defendants, posing as U.S. persons and creating false U.S. personas, operated social media pages and groups designed to attract U.S. audiences. These groups and pages, which addressed divisive U.S. political and social issues, falsely claimed to be controlled by U.S. activists when, in fact, they were controlled by Defendants. Defendants also used the stolen identities of real U.S. persons to post on ORGANIZATION-controlled social media accounts. Over time, these social media accounts became Defendants’ means to reach significant numbers of Americans for purposes of interfering with the U.S. political system, including the presidential election of 2016.”  

The indictment also notes that the IRA:

“[H]ad a strategic goal to sow discord in the U.S. political system, including the 2016 U.S. presidential election. Defendants posted derogatory information about a number of candidates, and by early to mid-2016, Defendants’ operations included supporting the presidential campaign of then-candidate Donald J. Trump (“Trump Campaign”) and disparaging Hillary Clinton. Defendants made various expenditures to carry out those activities, including buying political advertisements on social media in the names of U.S. persons and entities. Defendants also staged political rallies inside the United States, and while posing as U.S. grassroots entities and U.S. persons, and without revealing their Russian identities and ORGANIZATION affiliation, solicited and compensated real U.S. persons to promote or disparage candidates. Some Defendants, posing as U.S. persons and without revealing their Russian association, communicated with unwitting individuals associated with the Trump Campaign and with other political activists to seek to coordinate political activities.”

Source https://intelligence.house.gov/social-media-content/

上宣下化老和尚开示 Lectures by the Venerable Master Hsuan Hua

贪瞋痴是害人的魁首

Greed, Anger, and Stupidity Harm Us the Most

我们何时能息灭贪瞋痴，何时就能身心清净，没有烦恼。

When we completely wipe out greed, anger, and stupidity,
we will be pure in body and mind and free of afflictions.

人有贪心，永远不快乐；若是不贪，就有快乐，所以要止贪。

 	
Greedy people are never happy. Only those without greed can be happy. Therefore, we should not be greedy.

贪心有如无底坑，
填之难满瞋恨生；
五欲纷陈颠倒想，
痴然不觉法器崩。

 	
A greedy mind is like a bottomless pit.
Because it is hard to fill, anger arises.
A profusion of the five desires
 deludes our mind,
And the Dharma vessel disintegrates
 before we realize it.

因为贪心起，多少人为它身败名裂！多少人为它国破家亡！它是害人的东西，不可不谨慎。

 	
How many people have ruined their health and reputation because of greed? How many have caused their countries to perish and their families to break up? Greed is a harmful thing, and we must certainly be wary of it.

瞋要化为乌有，瞋火能烧毁一切功德，所以修道人首先要修忍辱波罗蜜，等修到炉火纯青的时候，就能化“瞋”为“慈”。瞋火就好像水变成冰，我们要把冰化成水，水能利益万物。

 	
We should quell our anger. The fire of anger can burn up all our merit and virtue. The first thing that cultivators should practice is patience. With great patience, we can turn anger into kindness. Anger is like ice; we have to melt it into water, for water can benefit many things.

痴若破除，智慧就现前。我们为什么有那么多的妄想？就因为太愚痴了。愚痴的原因就是无明，无明发动，催起欲念，就发生痴心妄想，想入非非，理智控制不了感情，就做了颠倒的事。这太危险了，容易令我们丧失道业。若把妄想除掉，愚痴自然消灭。

 	
If we can get rid of stupidity, our wisdom will manifest. Why do we have so many idle thoughts? Because we are very stupid. Stupidity is caused by ignorance. Ignorance sets off thoughts of desire. We entertain foolish, idle thoughts and go off on wild flights of fancy. Our rational mind cannot control our emotions, so we are led to do upside-down things. This is extremely dangerous, as we could easily lose our resolve to cultivate. Yet if we can cast out those idle thoughts, our stupidity will naturally cease.

总之，我们要息灭贪瞋痴，何时将三毒消除殆尽，何时就能身心清净，没有烦恼；没有烦恼，就得轻安的境界。到那时候，无忧无虑，无罣无碍，多么自在，多么逍遥！这个意义很深远的，希望各位仔细琢磨一番，把它研究明白，必能受益匪浅。

 	
In general, we must dispense with greed, anger and stupidity. When we completely wipe out these three poisons, we will be pure in body and mind and free of afflictions. Having no afflictions, we will experience a state of lightness and ease, free of worries and obstructions. How carefree we'll be! This is a profound principle. I've been asking that question every so often since the beginning of the virus outbreak.  Very few have responded like you have.  Until last week, I had one remaining great-aunt on my mom's side of the family.  She was 97.  The virus killed her.  The virus didn't care that she'd been a very nice, friendly, smart human being for most of her life.  The virus didn't care that I enjoyed visiting her trailer park in California in 1974 (when I was 7 years old).  I will miss her.  Very much.  She was much more like one of us "kids" rather than one of the adults.  She made things fun, even on hot, dry days.  I can see her face and hear her voice right now.  Heaven gets to have her back.  I wish there had been two of her, so that one could still be here on Earth.  How many other families have had members killed by the virus?  How many of those families wonder why more wasn't done sooner rather than later?  Especially here in America and in Brazil?  But politics don't care about viruses, just as viruses don't care about politics.  Viruses are equal opportunity; they will infect anyone (any political group, any gender, any sexual orientation, any size, almost any age, any skin color, any language, any culture, any religion (or lack thereof), and any country).  Surely the influenza epidemic of 1918 taught the world something.  And before that, the Black Plague.  But some of us think that history is irrelevant.  That science is irrelevant.  And, because we're human, some of us forget (either willingly or from involuntary ignorance), and then we have to go through hell again ... and again ... and again.  I don't want to lose another relative to the virus (or a parent, or a brother, or a cousin, or an aunt, or an uncle).  But I guess I'd better prepare myself for that eventuality.  It's happened once, and there's no reason to think it won't happen again.  It could happen to me.  It could happen to you.  It could happen to any of us users here on YouTube.  Does this mean anything to the White House?  To the GOP-controlled Senate?  To the people who are angrily demanding to go back to bars, movie theaters, beaches, tattoo parlors, hair salons, and political rallies?  I'm grateful for the quarantine, actually.  It means I'm still healthy and alive.  It means that my mom is still alive.  Her siblings are still alive.  Their children are alive.  My brothers are alive.  My nephews and nieces are alive.  My cousins are alive.  My friends are alive.  *steps off of soapbox*
